content:
Does inclusion in the CDA Problem Section imply membership in a Problem List, or is it a collection of all known problem observations?
Companion Guide 5.2.6: "Currently the Problem Section uses the Problem Concern template to record concerns commonly identified as being “on the patient’s problem list”."
Section code: 11450-4 (Problem List - Reported)
Knowing there are cases where this guidance is not followed, should we assume it is, try to change those cases, or decline to follow it?
Background: VA VHIE puts "Problem" file problems in problem list & "Visit" diagnoses in encounters, but aggregator also searches encounters and adds found diagnoses to Problems section.

This highly depends on the clinical workflow and implementation, and I don't believe it to be a simple problem to solve as a one size fits all solution. We did some work in IHE PCC several years ago around this creating a base concern entry, and derived entries for problem concern and allergy concern that may provide some addition understanding. These entries were then used in Profiles to provide further usage/use case constraints as appropriate. Check out section 6.3.4.11 in the PCC TF Vol 2: https://www.ihe.net/uploadedFiles/Documents/PCC/IHE_PCC_TF_Vol2.pdf
